required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomised, Phase I, 2-Period Crossover Trial to Investigate the Absolute Bioavailability and the Effect of Food on the Oral Bioavailability of AZD8566 in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A study designed to look at how the drug AZD8566 is taken up by the body when given with or without food. In some subjects a comparison will be made with a very small labelled microdose given into a vein.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic profile: concentration of AZD8566 in blood in the presence or absence of food
primary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken during visit 2 and visit 3, at up to 16 defined timepoints pre and post dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of AZD8566 in healthy volunteers in the fed and fasted state by assessment of vital signs, laboratory variables, ECGs and adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessments taken during visit 1 and at defined timepoints pre and post dose during visits 2 and 3. Volunteers will be monitored throughout the study for adverse events.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bioavailability of an oral solution formulation of AZD8566 in the fasted state compared with an intravenous carbon-14 microtracer dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples taken during visit 2, at up to 40 defined timepoints pre and post dose
Samples taken during visit 2, at up to 40 defined timepoints pre and post dose

intervention.description: Single 10 mcg intravenous carbon-14 microtracer dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of written informed consent
- Clinically normal physical findings and laboratory values as judged by the investigator with normal ECG
- Females who are permanently or surgically sterile or post-menopausal and males
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any convulsions or seizures
- History of infection or risk of infection due to recent surgery or trauma
- History or presence of conditions know to interfere with the absorption, distribution, metabolism and excretion of the study drug
